mods.note: During the Civil War, Nathaniel P. Banks was commissioned major general of volunteers in the Union army. He served in the Shenandoah Valley and Northern Virginia campaigns, the Siege of Port Hudson, and the unsuccessful Red River campaign. His letterpress copybook contains copies of official letters from Banks's headquarters of the Department of the Gulf in New Orleans for the periods August 1-October 15, 1863, and December 2, 1863-February 18, 1864.
mods.abstract: During the Civil War, Nathaniel P. Banks was commissioned major general of volunteers in the Union army. He served in the Shenandoah Valley and Northern Virginia campaigns, the Siege of Port Hudson, and the unsuccessful Red River campaign. His letterpress copybook contains copies of official letters from Banks's headquarters of the Department of the Gulf in New Orleans for the periods August 1-October 15, 1863, and December 2, 1863-February 18, 1864.
mods.accessCondition: Please submit an LSU Special Collections reference ticket at https://askus.lib.lsu.edu/special for any questions or comments about this digital object.
